cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.trajectory: turning northeast and then east-northeast, passing near Bermuda and tracking away into the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall forecast – closest approach expected near Bermuda

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect for Bermuda
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bermuda and adjacent western Atlantic waters
weather_observation.wind: None – tropical-storm-force winds will remain hundreds of miles north of Puerto Rico
weather_observation.rainfall: None significant – guidance shows only isolated outer-band showers well north of the island
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells may produce higher surf and strong rip currents along north-facing beaches of Puerto Rico, but port operations should not be interrupted
